poem:
### Morning Headlines

Among the crisp pages,  
railroads slice quiet deserts—  
iron whispers over land.  
Tariffs tangle in whispers  
of advisors' tongues,  
while deals, like autumn leaves  
nearly falling,  
hover in the air, waiting.  
Silent opinions loom,  
as the court's gavel rests,  
echoes of a waiting world  
humming in unseen tension.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump adviser confident tariff ruling will be overturned and says three trade deals nearly done – live 3.05pm BST We’re now getting lines from Reuters that the supreme court has ruled against environmental groups and a Colorado county that challenged the approval of a railway project in Utah. And, slightly anticlimactically, that’s the only ruling for today. Updated at 3.06pm BST 3.02pm BST We’re expecting at least one supreme court opinion this morning, starting any". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
